title: Rabbits
subtle: Descriptive (nonfiction), 32 words, Level A (Grade K), Lexile BR70L
description: In the book Rabbits, students will read about these cute, interesting animals. Although rabbits have many things in common, such as fur and hopping, they can also be very different from one another. Students have the opportunity to compare and contrast rabbits as well as to ask and answer questions. Detailed, supportive photographs, high-frequency words, and repetitive phrases support early emergent readers.
meta: big, black, fast, fluffy, rabbit, short, small, tall, white
Use the reading strategy of asking and answering questions to understand text
Compare and Contrast : Compare and contrast
Initial Consonants : Discriminate initial consonant /f/ sound
Concept Words : Recognize and use color words

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
